newsitem.title: USA: Hewlett-Packard to report higher third-quarter profit.
newsitem.headline: Hewlett-Packard to report higher third-quarter profit.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co. is expected to report improved third-quarter earnings Monday, reflecting stronger personal computer sales and more efficient operation.

For the past year, the second-biggest computer company has been struggling to report consistent revenue growth across all its product lines. Hewlett-Packard also has had trouble keeping some of its costs down.
This quarter, the Palo Alto, Calif., company looks to have most things under control analysts said.
"I believe this will be the start of the rebuilding of the momentum," said Steve Dube, analyst at investment bank Wasserstein Perella Securities in New York.
Wall Street expects the company to earn 68 cents a share, according to a recent survey by First Call.
Revenue for the quarter is expected to rise about 12 percent to $10.2 billion from the same quarter last year, analysts said.

In the third quarter last year, Hewlett-Packard had net income of $425 million, or 40 cents a share, on revenue of $9.11 billion. The results were hampered because of losses from a discontinued disk-drive components business and weaker-than-expected computer and printer sales.
Those troubles are mostly behind the company now, analysts said.
"They will have an easy comparison this quarter," said Richard Chu, analyst at Cowen & Co.
Hewlett-Packard is slated to announce its results at 8 a.m. EDT Monday.
